answers.answer: Sounds to me like you have gotten a curable form of Clymidia . Yes it IS an STD BUT, it forms when vaginitis is un cured causing the blatter to be resistant to ALL anti Biotics. See a doctor again and ask for a test (:

Hello,Recurrent UTI could be due to various reasons. Most common cause is stones in kidney which is blocking urine pathway. Other causes are changing sexual partners frequently, pregnancy, diabetes and of course childhood infections.The urine can also be due to retention of urine anywhere in its flow due t obstruction. The obstruction can be due to abnormality of structures since birth or stones. Females are more prone to urine infections. So you should get a ultrasound, CT scan done and also some urine and blood tests.I sincerely hope that helps. Please do keep me posted. Kind regards.

question: I have been on 3 different antibiotics in the last month trying to fight a UTI.  How come it won't go away?  I finished each round of each med.  First I took sulfameth for 10 days it seemed to help but two days after I finished it the UTI came back so I took cephalexin for 14 days it didn't seem to work as well as the first one but I finished it. The urgency to pee and the bladder spasms never really went away so now I'm taking cipro and it's not working at all I've been on it for 7 days so far.
